data.title: Visited again, as good as the first
data.text: While visiting Rapid City again on business, we stopped in for a very late lunch.  Appetizer of artichoke hearts, house salad, and then veggie pizza were all delicious and fresh.  Excellent place, I am surprised it isn't always packed.

owner_response.author: Jake2424, Owner at Kol, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Texastraveler-Thank you for taking the time to review our place.  We have tried to promote a great atmosphere and foodie environment.  We would sure like to be "packed".
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great food and service : make sure you go
data.text:
The food was excellent ...tasted like it was grilled over a campfire. Most interesting menu on our trip to the Black Hills. Not a "steak and potatoes " place. Full bar with wide selection of scotch, whiskey, liqueurs. 

Service was very prompt and friendly.

data.title: Kol is the place to dine Rapid C
data.text: Based on the online menu and restaurant reviews we stopped by Kol.  The restaurant is decorated with an urban modern feel.  Once seated, we were greeted by "Drew" who had suggestions on the drinks and menu items.  I settled on an Angry Orchard Cider and Meatballs & Pasta.  The hard cider and pasta was a good pairing for my palette. The meatballs were to die for.  Also, this was a healthy serving of Pasta so I took the remainder to go.  Great vibe, excellent service and tasty cuisine.   Kol is definitely the place to dine Rapid City.  Highly Recommended!

data.title: Yummy
data.text: This restaurant was across the street from our hotel and the menu looked interesting so we went. We got the teriyaki chicken wings which I had anticipated would be saucy but it was a dry rub. Those were amazing. Then we got the piggy figgy parm pizza which was probably one of the best things I have ever put in my face. For dessert we got creme brulee and that was also awesome. I had a cocktail with tequila and chile liqueur which was fun and delicious. My husband ordered an Empryean brown ale and was given a much lighter beer but it looks like the waiter had chosen the wrong beer when he rang it in, not the bartender thinking he could pass it as the brown ale. He was fine with this as what was brought to the table would have been his second choice. Will absolutely go back.

data.title: Really great brick oven fired pizza!
data.text: This is a pretty new place here in Rapid City. They are fairly expensive, but the pizza is really great. They bring it out to you fresh from the oven and it is very hot so make sure to let it cool before you eat. They also have other options, more of a high scale place to eat, lots of different options on the menu you don't find in other places in Rapid City.

data.title: A great little bar and bistro
data.text: Went on a Friday night when there was live music. A little loud at first but once acclimated, was a lot of fun. The pork belly with greens and a mustard sauce was outstanding and worth a try for the uninitiated. My guest had chicken kabobs and rice which were quite good as well. I like that the entire staff appear to enjoy working at this venue and not one of them sported a frown. Our server was happy to tell us about the entertainers and the other sister venue at which they play.

data.title: Great food and great service!
data.text: Met another couple at the restaurant for dinner. Food was excellent with a wide variety and Mr. Wes provided us with exceptional service! We will definitely be back!

data.title: Saturday afternoon
data.text: Chef Cody and chef Josh  were great-they came over after we had a few bites to check on our meal. Wes our server was very attentive.  Made my sons time far more enjoyable. We will be returning. Thank you for a great afternoon guys.

data.title: Date Night
data.text: Excellent food and service a bit pricey but we'll worth it. My wife and I have eaten here a few times and haven't been disappointed.

data.title: Nice decor, good service, need some work in the kitchen.
data.text: This spot seems to be a local favourite. We were able to get a table without a reservation and were looking forward to a treat.  Sadly, my roast chicken was bloody (not just a little red around the bone) and my wife's Mac & Cheese was extremely heavy, bland and not that warm.  Good service, but overall not as good as the hype.  I wouldn't give it a second chance.

owner_response.author: Jake2424, Owner at Kol, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for taking the time to review our place.  We really came up short on delivering a fun and unique experience.  Could you send me a PM and I will get a gift card out to you today.  We need to make this right.  Our apologies!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: ...should be ranked number 1....
data.text:
our party of 4 (2 60+ couples) tourists picked this restaurant based on generally good reviews by other Trip Advisors and its good/easy downtown location.  We initially stopped for a late Friday lunch and were so pleased with our choices that we returned for Sat night dinner.  Pizzas are unique and tasty, other choices from the relatively extensive menu also proved to be excellent...roasted beets were great. Creole Gumbo was quite hot. House specialty cocktails were interesting and good. Wait staff on each or our visits was personable, helpful, and attentive.
Our group readily recommends this restaurant....additionally as an enhancement for younger/more active crowd the lower central floor and bar area of the restaurant is cleared of tables approximately 10 PM and to convert to a nighttime venue for into-the-night dancing.  Judging from the number of young people lingering outside the entrance area on Saturday night this must also be a popular venue.

owner_response.author: Jake2424, Owner at Kol, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Randy-thank for the awesome response.  We have focuses very hard to have a product that will be approachable to the "Baby Boomers" and "Millennials".  Great review.  The staff loved your comments.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Happy Find at the End of our Tour of National Parks
data.text: Our hotel in Rapid City recommended Kol as a good place to have a fine dinner. The restaurant is chic and very high tech-looking. I had the steak salad which was excellent and my partner had spaghetti and meatballs, which were spicy good! We sat at the bar and our server was Wes, who has a great personality and was very attentive. He helped my partner get the kind of rye whiskey he wanted for his drink.

data.title: Great find!
data.text: We were encouraged to go to Kol by our host at the Hisega Lodge B&B and we are so happy we followed his advice!  The pizza, wine selection, salads were unique and flavorful!  We were there on a Saturday night - early - and were seated right away.  A line formed soon after however.   That night they had dueling pianos which was a great addition to the evening.  Wait staff were attentive and knowledgeable.  Prices were good, menu varied.  Wonderful ambiance for family or date.   Highly recommend!

data.title: Went THREE NIGHTS IN A ROW!!
data.text:
What does that tell you?

I didn't expect much from Rapid City, the food is secondary to the natural beauty which surrounds it in all directions.

The owners of the B&B where we were staying raved about kol.

First, you're greeted by a truly lovely woman (Can't remember her name: such pretty eyes and a 3 1/2 month baby! ) who sets the stage for a great experience.

My husband had a GREAT Caesar salad to which he added a generous portion of wonderful, freshly flown in salmon. (They do that every day.) I had a roasted chicken that had crispy skin and a juicy inside, with fingerling potatoes, a carrot purée with fresh baby carrots. Over the chicken was an incredibly delicious mushroom cream sauce with pearl onions and chives. 

It all worked so beautifully and I kept saying over and over to my husband, "It's just SO GOOD".

The next night we both did a salad with salmon, but I added it to their wedge salad, iceberg, Blue cheese, cherry tomatoes and in the menu is says "bacon" which it certainly was but not what we usually get! They were like little bacon chunks, and just that small thing( the quality of the pork and how it was cut), made a fun difference. The ranch dressing was good.

The second night we tried 2 desserts: the chocolate mousse, and the salted, caramel apple tort with fresh whipped cream( whipped cream also on the mousse). I felt like mousse!! IT WAS FANTASTIC!! Not real sweet or too chocolatey, nice texture. Simple. Great.

The tort wasn't huge but every bite was quality. 

The last night I had to have the chicken again (not very adventurous...), but my husband ordered the pasta Bolognese. It was a huge portion. Again, it was simple but delicious. At home he'd NEVER eat that much at one sitting.

The place is open, contemporary and doubles as a dance club on Fridays and Saturdays.

Ask for Drew. Great guy, great server, former Army Ranger, making him even more of a gift.

We promise you'll love it!

PS/ The menu is fantastic. Check it out online.
PSS/ We're not major drinkers, but heard that their drinks really ROCK!

owner_response.text: Could you just move to Rapid City and become our best customer ever?

data.title: Excellent find in Rapid City!
data.text: We were here for dinner with another couple.  Each of us ordered something different and we all loved our meals!  Very pleasant atmosphere and friendly owners.  We felt the prices were reasonable and we would definitely go back!  You won't be disappointed!

data.title: Wonderful service,wonderful food
data.text: Ore server, Drew was fabulous.  We were pressed for time at dinner and he made sure we got our food quickly.  The Caesar salad was a spilt for two, it's huge and tasty. The Pizza Margarita was crisp and flavorful.  Wish we had had more time to spend.  This is a great place.

data.title: A Gem for Rapid City
data.text:
Where do I begin?  We were traveling with another couple and stayed in the Rapid City area for 8 days.  We ate dinner here  4 out of the 8 days and were so fortunate to find this place early in the stay.  The restaurant is a contemporary feel, casual but classy.  All employees we came in contact with were friendly and we felt like they liked their jobs.  Thank you Cody and Wes for your excellent service.  Food:  Not your usual bar menu.  KOL cares where their food comes from and is prepared and presented in amazing fashion.  A couple of our favorites:  Pig & Parmesan sandwich and Spinach Gorgonzola soup.  It is priced in mid-range and servings are generous.   However, they have fresh seafood flown in which is a little pricey, understandably.  We hear that to assure yourself of this seafood, you need to call and reserve as they were usually sold out by the time we dined.  
On some evenings they have entertainment such as dueling pianos.  This is a place where  younger and older generations come together and all seems to have a great time.  KOL is quickly climbing in the ratings and this is well deserved.

data.title: Delightful menu for a special occasion
data.text:
The restaurant is beautiful and the menu is really fun. I tried the pork belly appetizer purely out of curiosity and it was a tasty treat and none of the connotations 'pork belly' conjure up for me proved to be real. The appetizer was tender and exceptionally tasty. Try it! I also loved the bison kabobs and the pizza someone at our table ordered (sorry but can't recall which it was.) 

The staff went the extra mile for our birthday girls and the champagne complete with sparklers was festive. Because we chose to dine very late, things were a bit awkward as the restaurant transitions to a night club after ten, and the night club atmosphere was not our cup of tea, but we were delighted that we chose Kol and we will be back for lunch or dinner again soon. The staff, by the way, was fun, friendly and went out of their way to help make our special occasion very special.

data.title: Great find
data.text:
We were surprised to find a restaurant of this quality in a relatively small city. The service was excellent, the menu was not huge,but had numerous selections that could please anyone in a party. The wine list was very well chosen. The food was excellent.

Highly recommend!

data.title: Great Evening Dining
data.text: While staying downtown in Rapid, our group found KOL.  We had beer,wine and several menu items that were excellent. Very enjoyable!
